channel.title: Home on Columbia Psychology: Prospective Visit Days

item.title: Resources
item.description: Resources During Prospective Visit Days, we will use a few different platforms to facilitate your virtual visit. If you have any questions about how to use them, or if you experience any unforeseen technical difficulties, please don’t hesitate to let us know! Kumospace Kumospace is an immersive video chat platform that allows people to mingle within a virtual event space. During Prospective Visit Days, social events will take place at the event-specific Kumospace links found on the Schedule page.

item.title: Schedule
item.description: Schedule Wednesday, February 17th 6:00p onward Virtual Social Event Prospective and current graduate students Kumospace Thursday, February 18th 10:00a - 10:30a Welcome Dr. Kevin Ochsner, Department Chair [Faculty Profile] Zoom 10:30a - 10:40a Break 10:40a - 11:20a Faculty Meeting 1 Zoom (see email) 11:25a - 12:05p Faculty Meeting 2 Zoom (see email) 12:05p - 1:00p Break (Lunch) 1:00p - 1:40p Faculty Meeting 3 Zoom (see email) 1:45p - 2:25p Faculty Meeting 4 Zoom (see email) 2:25p - 3:00p Break 3:00p - 3:30p Information Session

item.title: Virtual Tour
item.description: Virtual Tour Campus Although Columbia University was established in 1754, it moved throughout New York City several times before settling in its current location in 1897. Schermerhorn Hall, the location of the psychology department, is one of the original buildings in this current location. To learn more, check out the following virtual tour! Other useful resources: Columbia’s Official Virtual Tour Website Morningside Heights Columbia is located in the Morningside Heights, which is nestled between the Upper West Side and Harlem in the borough of Manhattan.
